critique: The document focuses on national security and defense preparedness. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of security and confidence in the government's ability to protect the nation. There's also an element of reassurance that resources will be available in times of need. The language is formal and authoritative, aiming to inspire trust and stability. There is little to no emotion of joy, sadness, or disgust. There is some element of fear that the document is trying to address by reassuring the public. There is also some element of surprise in the actions that the government is willing to take to ensure national security.
